definition: extending or moving from a higher to a lower place, spatially or metaphorically from a higher to a lower level or position, a complete play to advance the football, in American football, improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
details:
adjective
- extending or moving from a higher to a lower place
= synonyms: downward
- becoming progressively lower
- not functioning (temporarily or permanently)
= example: not functioning (temporarily or permanently)
- shut
= example: shut
- understood perfectly
= example: understood perfectly
= synonyms: down pat, mastered
- being or moving lower in position or less in some value
= example: being or moving lower in position or less in some value
- filled with melancholy and despondency
= synonyms: low
- lower than previously
= synonyms: depressed
- being put out by a strikeout
adverb
- spatially or metaphorically from a higher to a lower level or position
= example: spatially or metaphorically from a higher to a lower level or position
= synonyms: downwards, downward, downwardly
- away from a more central or a more northerly place
= example: away from a more central or a more northerly place
- paid in cash at time of purchase
= example: paid in cash at time of purchase
- in an inactive or inoperative state
= example: in an inactive or inoperative state
- to a lower intensity
= example: to a lower intensity
- from an earlier time
= example: from an earlier time
noun
- a complete play to advance the football, in American football
= example: a complete play to advance the football, in American football
- soft fine feathers
= synonyms: down feather
- fine soft dense hair (as the fine short hair of cattle or deer or the wool of sheep or the undercoat of certain dogs)
= synonyms: pile
- (usually plural) a rolling treeless highland with little soil
verb
- improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
= synonyms: polish, fine-tune, refine
- bring down or defeat (an opponent)
- eat immoderately
= example: eat immoderately
= synonyms: go through
- drink down entirely
= example: drink down entirely
= synonyms: kill
- cause to come or go down
= example: cause to come or go down
= synonyms: knock down, cut down, push down, pull down
- shoot at and force to come down
= synonyms: shoot down, land
